## Full analysis

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Load packages required for meta-analysis
library(metafor)
library(forestplot)
library(ggplot2)

# Import data and plot settings
data = read.csv("Church_et_al_2018_metaregression_input.csv",header=TRUE, stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
settings = read.csv("Church_et_al_2018_plot_settings.csv",header=TRUE, stringsAsFactors=FALSE)

# Select intervention, then subset data
intervention = "Antihelminthic"
data1 = subset(data, Intervention_category==intervention)

# Replace '--' with '-' characters in age column
data1$Age_formatted = gsub("--", "-", data1$Age_formatted)

# Set plotting parameters for selected intervention (axis limits, plot height, plot width, and footnote coordinates)
forest_x_min_main	= settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"forest_x_min_main"]
forest_x_max_main	= settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"forest_x_max_main"]
forest_x_min_polio	= settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"forest_x_min_polio"]
forest_x_max_polio	= settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"forest_x_max_polio"]
plot_width_main	= settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"plot_width_main"]
plot_width_polio	= settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"plot_width_polio"]
plot_height_main = settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"plot_height_main"]
plot_height_polio	= settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"plot_height_polio"]
footnote_x_main = settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"footnote_x_main"]
footnote_y_main = settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"footnote_y_main"]
footnote_x_polio = settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"footnote_x_polio"]
footnote_y_polio = settings[which(settings$intervention==intervention),"footnote_y_polio"]

# Create subsets of data for each vaccine target
data_cholera = subset(data1,Vaccine=="Cholera")
data_rota = subset(data1,Vaccine=="Rotavirus")
data_PV1 = subset(data1,Measure_of_SC=="OPV1 N-AB")
data_PV2 = subset(data1,Measure_of_SC=="OPV2 N-AB")
data_PV3 = subset(data1,Measure_of_SC=="OPV3 N-AB")

# Create two collated versions of dataset - one for CV, RV and PV3; one for all types of polio
data_all = rbind(data_cholera, data_rota, data_PV3)
data_PV_all = rbind(data_PV1, data_PV2, data_PV3)

# Set minimum study count for inclusion in meta-analysis
min = 2
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Calculate sums of N by vaccine
cholera_sum = sum(data_all$Total[data_all$Vaccine=="Cholera"])
rota_sum = sum(data_all$Total[data_all$Vaccine=="Rotavirus"])
polio_sum = sum(data_all$Total[data_all$Vaccine=="Polio"])
overall_sum = sum(data_all$Total)

# Calculate number of vaccines included in analysis
n_vaccines = as.numeric(cholera_sum>0) + as.numeric(rota_sum>0) + as.numeric(polio_sum>0)

# Calculate summary statistics for each subset
if (cholera_sum>0) { dat_cholera = escalc(measure = "RR", ai = Int_SC_n, bi = Int_N-Int_SC_n, ci = Ctrl_SC_n, di = Ctrl_N-Ctrl_SC_n, data = data_cholera, append = TRUE) }
if (rota_sum>0) { dat_rota = escalc(measure = "RR", ai = Int_SC_n, bi = Int_N-Int_SC_n, ci = Ctrl_SC_n, di = Ctrl_N-Ctrl_SC_n, data = data_rota, append = TRUE) }
if (polio_sum>0) { dat_PV3 = escalc(measure = "RR", ai = Int_SC_n, bi = Int_N-Int_SC_n, ci = Ctrl_SC_n, di = Ctrl_N-Ctrl_SC_n, data = data_PV3, append = TRUE) }
dat_all = escalc(measure = "RR", ai = Int_SC_n, bi = Int_N-Int_SC_n, ci = Ctrl_SC_n, di = Ctrl_N-Ctrl_SC_n, data = data_all, append = TRUE)

# Perform REML meta-analyses
if (cholera_sum>0) { meta_cholera = rma(yi, vi, data = dat_cholera, method = "REML") }
if (rota_sum>0) { meta_rota = rma(yi, vi, data = dat_rota, method = "REML") }
if (polio_sum>0) { meta_PV3 = rma(yi, vi, data = dat_PV3, method = "REML") }

# Perform combined meta-analysis, including random effect on study ID if intervention is 'RVV separated from OPV' (to account for replication of infants for RVV and OPV outcomes)
if (intervention=="RVV separated from OPV") { meta_all = rma.mv(yi, vi, data = dat_all, method = "REML", random = ~ 1 | Reference) }
if (intervention!="RVV separated from OPV") { meta_all = rma(yi, vi, data = dat_all, method = "REML") }

# Perform mixed-effects meta-regression, including random effect on study ID for 'RVV separated from OPV'
if (nrow(dat_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1 & intervention=="RVV separated from OPV") { mixed_all = rma.mv(yi, vi, mods = ~ Vaccine, data = dat_all,  method = "REML", random = ~ 1 | Reference) }
if (nrow(dat_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1 & intervention!="RVV separated from OPV") { mixed_all = rma(yi, vi, mods = ~ Vaccine, data = dat_all,  method = "REML") }
if (n_vaccines==1) {
    mixed_all = NA
    mixed_all$QEp = mixed_all$QMp = 1 } # if there is only 1 vaccine type, assign arbitrary value of 1 to mixed_all p values so as to avoid errors in later logical operators

# Create function to extract RRs and CIs from individual studies in rma meta-analysis output
RR_CIs = function(x) {
    paste0(formatC(round(exp(x$yi),2),format='f',digits=2)," (",formatC(round(exp(x$yi-1.96*sqrt(x$vi)),2),format='f',digits=2),"-",formatC(round(exp(x$yi+1.96*sqrt(x$vi)),2),format='f',digits=2),")")
}

# Create function to extract overall RRs and CIs from rma meta-analysis output
RR_summary = function(x) {
    paste0(formatC(round(exp(x$b),2),format='f',digits=2)," (", formatC(round(exp(x$b-1.96*x$se),2),format='f',digits=2), "-", formatC(round(exp(x$b+1.96*x$se),2),format='f',digits=2),")")
}

# Create function to collate relevant data for each column of forest plot
table_column = function(column_title, ref) {
    column = column_title # specify column title
    if (nrow(data_cholera)>0) { column = c(column,NA,data_cholera[,ref]) } # add study-specific rows if there is at least one study
    if (nrow(data_cholera)<min & nrow(data_cholera)>0) { column = c(column,NA) } # add gap if number of studies is <min
    if (nrow(data_cholera)>=min) { column = c(column,NA,NA) } # add summary row if number of studies is >=min
    
    if (nrow(data_rota)>0) { column = c(column,NA,data_rota[,ref]) }
    if (nrow(data_rota)<min & nrow(data_rota)>0) { column = c(column,NA) }
    if (nrow(data_rota)>=min) { column = c(column,NA,NA) }
    
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { column = c(column,NA,data_PV3[,ref]) }
    if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { column = c(column,NA) }
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { column = c(column,NA,NA) }
    
    if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1) { column = c(column,NA) }
    if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines==1) { column = column[-length(column)] }
    return(column)
}

# Use function to create meta-data columns for forest plot
country = table_column(column_title="Country", ref="Country")
age = table_column(column_title="Age (m)", ref="Age_formatted")
vaccine = table_column(column_title="Vaccine", ref="Vaccine_formatted")
intervention = table_column(column_title="Intervention", ref="Intervention_formatted")
N_int = table_column(column_title="n/N (%)", ref="Int_SC_full")
control = table_column(column_title="Control", ref="Control_formatted")
N_ctrl = table_column(column_title="n/N (%)", ref="Ctrl_SC_full")

# Create first column composed of Study IDs and vaccine names
titles = "Study"
if (nrow(data_cholera)>0) { titles = c(titles,"Cholera",data_cholera$Reference) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)<min & nrow(data_cholera)>0) { titles = c(titles,NA) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)>=min) { titles = c(titles,"Summary",NA) }

if (nrow(data_rota)>0) { titles = c(titles,"Rotavirus",data_rota$Reference) }
if (nrow(data_rota)<min & nrow(data_rota)>0) { titles = c(titles,NA) }
if (nrow(data_rota)>=min) { titles = c(titles,"Summary",NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { titles = c(titles,"OPV3",data_PV3$Reference) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { titles = c(titles,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { titles = c(titles,"Summary",NA) }

if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1) { titles = c(titles, "Overall") }
if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines==1) { titles = titles[-length(titles)] }

# Create final column composed of RRs and 95% CIs
RRs = "RR (95% CI)"
if (nrow(data_cholera)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA,RR_CIs(meta_cholera)) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)<min & nrow(data_cholera)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)>=min) { RRs = c(RRs,RR_summary(meta_cholera),NA) }

if (nrow(data_rota)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA,RR_CIs(meta_rota)) }
if (nrow(data_rota)<min & nrow(data_rota)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA) }
if (nrow(data_rota)>=min) { RRs = c(RRs,RR_summary(meta_rota),NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA,RR_CIs(meta_PV3)) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { RRs = c(RRs,RR_summary(meta_PV3),NA) }

if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1) { RRs = c(RRs,RR_summary(meta_all)) }
if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines==1) { RRs = RRs[-length(RRs)] }

# Collate forest plot text
tabletext = cbind(titles, country, age, vaccine, intervention, N_int, control, N_ctrl, RRs)

# Create variable composed of RRs
m = NA
if (nrow(data_cholera)>0) { m = c(m,NA,meta_cholera$yi) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)<min & nrow(data_cholera)>0) { m = c(m,NA) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)>=min) { m = c(m,meta_cholera$b,NA) }

if (nrow(data_rota)>0) { m = c(m,NA,meta_rota$yi) }
if (nrow(data_rota)<min & nrow(data_rota)>0) { m = c(m,NA) }
if (nrow(data_rota)>=min) { m = c(m,meta_rota$b,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { m = c(m,NA,meta_PV3$yi) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { m = c(m,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { m = c(m,meta_PV3$b,NA) }

if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1) { m = c(m,meta_all$b) }
if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines==1) { m = m[-length(m)] }

# Create variables for lower CI limits of RR estimates
l = NA
if (nrow(data_cholera)>0) { l = c(l,NA,meta_cholera$yi-sqrt(meta_cholera$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)<min & nrow(data_cholera)>0) { l = c(l,NA) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)>=min) { l = c(l,meta_cholera$b-meta_cholera$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_rota)>0) { l = c(l,NA,meta_rota$yi-sqrt(meta_rota$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_rota)<min & nrow(data_rota)>0) { l = c(l,NA) }
if (nrow(data_rota)>=min) { l = c(l,meta_rota$b-meta_rota$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { l = c(l,NA,meta_PV3$yi-sqrt(meta_PV3$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { l = c(l,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { l = c(l,meta_PV3$b-meta_PV3$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1) { l = c(l,meta_all$b-meta_all$se*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines==1) { l = l[-length(l)] }

# Create variables for upper CI limits of RR estimates
u = NA
if (nrow(data_cholera)>0) { u = c(u,NA,meta_cholera$yi+sqrt(meta_cholera$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)<min & nrow(data_cholera)>0) { u = c(u,NA) }
if (nrow(data_cholera)>=min) { u = c(u,meta_cholera$b+meta_cholera$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_rota)>0) { u = c(u,NA,meta_rota$yi+sqrt(meta_rota$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_rota)<min & nrow(data_rota)>0) { u = c(u,NA) }
if (nrow(data_rota)>=min) { u = c(u,meta_rota$b+meta_rota$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { u = c(u,NA,meta_PV3$yi+sqrt(meta_PV3$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { u = c(u,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { u = c(u,meta_PV3$b+meta_PV3$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1) { u = c(u,meta_all$b+meta_all$se*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_all)>=min & n_vaccines==1) { u = u[-length(u)] }
```

### Forest plot

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=plot_width_main, fig.height=plot_height_main}
# Create function to assign colours to meta-analysis boxes and lines
# Adapted from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46938910
fn <- local({
    i = 0
    b_clrs = vector()
    if (nrow(data_cholera)>0) { b_clrs = rep("#90B11F", nrow(data_cholera)) }
    if (nrow(data_rota)>0) { b_clrs = c(b_clrs, rep("#D43E55", nrow(data_rota))) }
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { b_clrs = c(b_clrs, rep("#F1A44F", nrow(data_PV3))) }
    b_clrs = c(b_clrs, "black")
    l_clrs = rep("grey", length(b_clrs))
    # l_clrs = b_clrs # use this line instead of the line above to make lines the same colour as the boxes
    
    function(..., clr.line, clr.marker){
        i <<- i + 1
        fpDrawNormalCI(..., clr.line = l_clrs[i], clr.marker = b_clrs[i])
    }
})

# Create function to assign colours to meta-analysis summary diamonds
# Adapted from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46938910
fn_sum <- local({
    i = 0
    b_clrs_sum = vector()
    if (nrow(data_cholera)>=min) { b_clrs_sum = 	"#90B11F" }
    if (nrow(data_rota)>=min) { b_clrs_sum = c(b_clrs_sum, "#D43E55") }
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { b_clrs_sum = c(b_clrs_sum, "#F1A44F") }
    b_clrs_sum = c(b_clrs_sum, "black")
    function(..., col){
        i <<- i + 1
        fpDrawSummaryCI(..., col = b_clrs_sum[i])
    }
})

# Creat forest plot
if (nrow(data_all)>=min) {
    forestplot(tabletext,exp(m),exp(l),exp(u),zero=1,
    is.summary=c(TRUE,TRUE,!is.na(tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]) & (tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="Summary" | tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="Overall"| tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="Cholera"| tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="Rotavirus"| tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="OPV3")),
    clip=c(forest_x_min_main,forest_x_max_main), xlog=TRUE,
    xticks=c(forest_x_min_main,1,forest_x_max_main),
    fn.ci_norm=fn,
    fn.ci_sum=fn_sum,
    colgap=unit(5,"mm"),
    txt_gp = fpTxtGp(ticks = gpar(cex=0.8))
    )
    
    # Add footnote containing heterogeneity results
    if (nrow(dat_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1 & mixed_all$QEp>=0.001) {
        grid.text(paste0("Heterogeneity among vaccines (Qm ", formatC(round(mixed_all$QM,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", mixed_all$m, "), p = ", formatC(round(mixed_all$QMp,3),format='f',digits=3),
        "; Residual heterogeneity (Qe ", formatC(round(mixed_all$QE,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", mixed_all$k-mixed_all$p, "), p = ", formatC(round(mixed_all$QEp,3),format='f',digits=3)),
        footnote_x_main, footnote_y_main, gp = gpar(fontsize=12, font = "sans")) }
    if (nrow(dat_all)>=min & n_vaccines>1 & mixed_all$QEp<0.001) {
        grid.text(paste0("Heterogeneity among vaccines (Qm ", formatC(round(mixed_all$QM,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", mixed_all$m, "), p = ", formatC(round(mixed_all$QMp,3),format='f',digits=3),
        "; Residual heterogeneity (Qe ", formatC(round(mixed_all$QE,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", mixed_all$k-mixed_all$p, "), p < 0.001"),
        footnote_x_main, footnote_y_main, gp = gpar(fontsize=12, font = "sans")) }
    
    if (nrow(dat_all)>=min & n_vaccines==1 & meta_all$QEp>=0.001) {
        grid.text(paste0("Heterogeneity (Q ", formatC(round(meta_all$QE,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", meta_all$k-meta_all$p, "), p = ", formatC(round(meta_all$QEp,3),format='f',digits=3)),
        footnote_x_main, footnote_y_main, gp = gpar(fontsize=12, font = "sans")) }
    if (nrow(dat_all)>=min & n_vaccines==1 & meta_all$QEp<0.001) {
        grid.text(paste0("Heterogeneity (Q ", formatC(round(meta_all$QE,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", meta_all$k-meta_all$p, "), p < 0.001"),
        footnote_x_main, footnote_y_main, gp = gpar(fontsize=12, font = "sans")) }
    
} else { print("Insufficient studies (n<2)") }
```

### Funnel plot

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, fig.height=3, fig.width=6}
# Draw funnel plot containing all results included in meta-analysis
overall_estimate = meta_all$b
funnel_input = data.frame(SE = sqrt(meta_all$vi), LogRR = meta_all$yi, Vaccine = data_all$Vaccine, N = data_all$Total)
ggplot(funnel_input, aes(y=SE, x=LogRR)) + geom_point(aes(color = Vaccine), size=3.5, alpha=0.7) +
geom_vline(xintercept=overall_estimate, color='grey', linetype='dashed') + theme_minimal() +
ylab('SE (log RR)') + xlab('log RR') +  scale_y_reverse() + xlim(-2,2) +
scale_color_manual(values = c("Cholera" = "#90B11F", "Polio" = "#F1A44F" , "Rotavirus" =  "#D43E55")) +
theme(legend.title=element_blank(), legend.position="right")
```

### Egger's test

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Perform Egger's test; for 'RVV separated from OPV', this should be stratified by vaccine type to account for replication of infants for RVV and OPV outcomes
if (nrow(dat_all)<3) { print("Insufficient studies (n<3)") }

if (nrow(dat_all)>=3 & intervention!="RVV separated from OPV" & mixed_all$QMp>=0.05) {
    print("No replication of infants across vaccines or significant vaccine effect, therefore combined test performed")
    regtest(meta_all, predictor="sei") }

if (nrow(dat_all)>=3 & (intervention=="RVV separated from OPV" | mixed_all$QMp<0.05)) {
    print("Infants replicated across vaccines or vaccine effect significant, therefore separate tests performed")
    print("Cholera:")
    if (nrow(data_cholera)>=3) { print(regtest(meta_cholera, predictor="sei")) } else { print("Insufficient studies (n<3)")}
    print("Rotavirus:")
    if (nrow(data_rota)>=3) { print(regtest(meta_rota, predictor="sei")) } else { print("Insufficient studies (n<3)")}
    print("OPV3:")
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>=3) { print(regtest(meta_PV3, predictor="sei")) } else { print("Insufficient studies (n<3)")}
}
```

## OPV-specific analysis

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Calculate sums of N by vaccine
PV1_sum = sum(data_PV_all$Total[data_PV_all$Measure_of_SC=="OPV1 N-AB"])
PV2_sum = sum(data_PV_all$Total[data_PV_all$Measure_of_SC=="OPV2 N-AB"])
PV3_sum = sum(data_PV_all$Total[data_PV_all$Measure_of_SC=="OPV3 N-AB"])
overall_PV_sum = sum(data_PV_all$Total)

# Calculate number of vaccines included in analysis
n_PV_vaccines = as.numeric(PV1_sum>0) + as.numeric(PV2_sum>0) + as.numeric(PV3_sum>0)

# Calculate summary statistics for each subset
if (PV1_sum>0) {dat_PV1 = escalc(measure = "RR", ai = Int_SC_n, bi = Int_N-Int_SC_n, ci = Ctrl_SC_n, di = Ctrl_N-Ctrl_SC_n, data = data_PV1, append = TRUE) }
if (PV2_sum>0) {dat_PV2 = escalc(measure = "RR", ai = Int_SC_n, bi = Int_N-Int_SC_n, ci = Ctrl_SC_n, di = Ctrl_N-Ctrl_SC_n, data = data_PV2, append = TRUE) }
if (PV3_sum>0) {dat_PV3 = escalc(measure = "RR", ai = Int_SC_n, bi = Int_N-Int_SC_n, ci = Ctrl_SC_n, di = Ctrl_N-Ctrl_SC_n, data = data_PV3, append = TRUE) }
if (overall_PV_sum>0) {dat_PV_all = escalc(measure = "RR", ai = Int_SC_n, bi = Int_N-Int_SC_n, ci = Ctrl_SC_n, di = Ctrl_N-Ctrl_SC_n, data = data_PV_all, append = TRUE) }

# Perform REML meta-analyses
if (PV1_sum>0) { meta_PV1 = rma(yi, vi, data = dat_PV1, method = "REML") }
if (PV2_sum>0) { meta_PV2 = rma(yi, vi, data = dat_PV2, method = "REML") }
if (PV3_sum>0) { meta_PV3 = rma(yi, vi, data = dat_PV3, method = "REML") }

# Perform combined meta-analysis, including random effect on study ID
if (overall_PV_sum>0) { meta_PV_all = rma.mv(yi, vi, data = dat_PV_all, method = "REML", random = ~ 1 | Reference) }

# Perform mixed-effects meta-regression, including random effect on study ID
if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1) { mixed_PV_all = rma.mv(yi, vi, mods = ~ Measure_of_SC, data = dat_PV_all,  method = "REML", random = ~ 1 | Reference) }
if (n_PV_vaccines==1) {
    mixed_PV_all = NA
    mixed_PV_all$QEp = mixed_PV_all$QMp = 1 } # if there is only 1 vaccine type, assign arbitrary value of 1 to mixed_all p values so as to avoid errors in later logical operators

# Create function to collate relevant data for each column of PV-specific forest plot
table_column_PV = function(column_title, ref) {
    column = column_title # specify column title
    if (nrow(data_PV1)>0) { column = c(column,NA,data_PV1[,ref]) } # add study-specific rows if there is at least one study
    if (nrow(data_PV1)<min & nrow(data_PV1)>0) { column = c(column,NA) } # add gap if number of studies is <min
    if (nrow(data_PV1)>=min) { column = c(column,NA,NA) } # add summary row if number of studies is >=min
    
    if (nrow(data_PV2)>0) { column = c(column,NA,data_PV2[,ref]) }
    if (nrow(data_PV2)<min & nrow(data_PV2)>0) { column = c(column,NA) }
    if (nrow(data_PV2)>=min) { column = c(column,NA,NA) }
    
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { column = c(column,NA,data_PV3[,ref]) }
    if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { column = c(column,NA) }
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { column = c(column,NA,NA) }
    if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1) { column = c(column,NA) }
    if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines==1) { column = column[-length(column)] }
    return(column)
}

# Use function to create meta-data columns for forest plot
country = table_column_PV(column_title="Country", ref="Country")
age = table_column_PV(column_title="Age (m)", ref="Age_formatted")
vaccine = table_column_PV(column_title="Vaccine", ref="Vaccine_formatted")
intervention = table_column_PV(column_title="Intervention", ref="Intervention_formatted")
N_int = table_column_PV(column_title="n/N (%)", ref="Int_SC_full")
control = table_column_PV(column_title="Control", ref="Control_formatted")
N_ctrl = table_column_PV(column_title="n/N (%)", ref="Ctrl_SC_full")

# Create first column composed of Study IDs and vaccine names
titles = "Study"
if (nrow(data_PV1)>0) { titles = c(titles,"OPV1",data_PV1$Reference) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)<min & nrow(data_PV1)>0) { titles = c(titles,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)>=min) { titles = c(titles,"Summary",NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV2)>0) { titles = c(titles,"OPV2",data_PV2$Reference) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)<min & nrow(data_PV2)>0) { titles = c(titles,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)>=min) { titles = c(titles,"Summary",NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { titles = c(titles,"OPV3",data_PV3$Reference) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { titles = c(titles,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { titles = c(titles,"Summary",NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1) { titles = c(titles, "Overall") }
if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines==1) { titles = titles[-length(titles)] }

# Create final column composed of RRs and 95% CIs
RRs = "RR (95% CI)"
if (nrow(data_PV1)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA,RR_CIs(meta_PV1)) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)<min & nrow(data_PV1)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)>=min) { RRs = c(RRs,RR_summary(meta_PV1),NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV2)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA,RR_CIs(meta_PV2)) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)<min & nrow(data_PV2)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)>=min) { RRs = c(RRs,RR_summary(meta_PV2),NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA,RR_CIs(meta_PV3)) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { RRs = c(RRs,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { RRs = c(RRs,RR_summary(meta_PV3),NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1) { RRs = c(RRs,RR_summary(meta_PV_all)) }
if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines==1) { RRs = RRs[-length(RRs)] }

# Collate forest plot text
tabletext = cbind(titles, country, age, vaccine, intervention, N_int, control, N_ctrl, RRs)

# Create variable composed of RRs
m = NA
if (nrow(data_PV1)>0) { m = c(m,NA,meta_PV1$yi) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)<min & nrow(data_PV1)>0) { m = c(m,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)>=min) { m = c(m,meta_PV1$b,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV2)>0) { m = c(m,NA,meta_PV2$yi) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)<min & nrow(data_PV2)>0) { m = c(m,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)>=min) { m = c(m,meta_PV2$b,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { m = c(m,NA,meta_PV3$yi) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { m = c(m,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { m = c(m,meta_PV3$b,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1) { m = c(m,meta_PV_all$b) }
if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines==1) { m = m[-length(m)] }

# Create variables for lower CI limits of RR estimates
l = NA
if (nrow(data_PV1)>0) { l = c(l,NA,meta_PV1$yi-sqrt(meta_PV1$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)<min & nrow(data_PV1)>0) { l = c(l,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)>=min) { l = c(l,meta_PV1$b-meta_PV1$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV2)>0) { l = c(l,NA,meta_PV2$yi-sqrt(meta_PV2$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)<min & nrow(data_PV2)>0) { l = c(l,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)>=min) { l = c(l,meta_PV2$b-meta_PV2$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { l = c(l,NA,meta_PV3$yi-sqrt(meta_PV3$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { l = c(l,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { l = c(l,meta_PV3$b-meta_PV3$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1) { l = c(l,meta_PV_all$b-meta_PV_all$se*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines==1) { l = l[-length(l)] }

# Create variables for upper CI limits of RR estimates
u = NA
if (nrow(data_PV1)>0) { u = c(u,NA,meta_PV1$yi+sqrt(meta_PV1$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)<min & nrow(data_PV1)>0) { u = c(u,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV1)>=min) { u = c(u,meta_PV1$b+meta_PV1$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV2)>0) { u = c(u,NA,meta_PV2$yi+sqrt(meta_PV2$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)<min & nrow(data_PV2)>0) { u = c(u,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV2)>=min) { u = c(u,meta_PV2$b+meta_PV2$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { u = c(u,NA,meta_PV3$yi+sqrt(meta_PV3$vi)*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)<min & nrow(data_PV3)>0) { u = c(u,NA) }
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { u = c(u,meta_PV3$b+meta_PV3$se*1.96,NA) }

if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1) { u = c(u,meta_PV_all$b+meta_PV_all$se*1.96) }
if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines==1) { u = u[-length(u)] }
```

### Forest plot

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=plot_width_polio, fig.height=plot_height_polio}
# Create function to assign colours to meta-analysis boxes and lines
# Adapted from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46938910
fn <- local({
    i = 0
    b_clrs = vector()
    if (nrow(data_PV1)>0) { b_clrs = rep("#f1cd4f", nrow(data_PV1)) }
    if (nrow(data_PV2)>0) { b_clrs = c(b_clrs, rep("#734109", nrow(data_PV2))) }
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>0) { b_clrs = c(b_clrs, rep("#F1A44F", nrow(data_PV3))) }
    b_clrs = c(b_clrs, "black")
    l_clrs = rep("grey", length(b_clrs))
    # l_clrs = b_clrs # use this line instead of the line above to make lines the same colour as the boxes
    
    function(..., clr.line, clr.marker){
        i <<- i + 1
        fpDrawNormalCI(..., clr.line = l_clrs[i], clr.marker = b_clrs[i])
    }
})

# Create function to assign colours to meta-analysis summary diamonds
# Adapted from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46938910
fn_sum <- local({
    i = 0
    b_clrs_sum = vector()
    if (nrow(data_PV1)>=min) { b_clrs_sum = 	"#f1cd4f" }
    if (nrow(data_PV2)>=min) { b_clrs_sum = c(b_clrs_sum, "#734109") }
    if (nrow(data_PV3)>=min) { b_clrs_sum = c(b_clrs_sum, "#F1A44F") }
    b_clrs_sum = c(b_clrs_sum, "black")
    function(..., col){
        i <<- i + 1
        fpDrawSummaryCI(..., col = b_clrs_sum[i])
    }
})

# Creat forest plot
if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min) {
    forestplot(tabletext,exp(m),exp(l),exp(u),zero=1,
    is.summary=c(TRUE,TRUE,!is.na(tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]) & (tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="Summary" | tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="Overall"| tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="OPV1"| tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="OPV2"| tabletext[3:nrow(tabletext),1]=="OPV3")),
    clip=c(forest_x_min_polio,forest_x_max_polio), xlog=TRUE,

    fn.ci_sum=fn_sum,

    txt_gp = fpTxtGp(ticks = gpar(cex=0.8))
    )
    
    # Add footnote containing heterogeneity results
    if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1 & mixed_PV_all$QEp>=0.001) {
        grid.text(paste0("Heterogeneity among vaccines (Qm ", formatC(round(mixed_PV_all$QM,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", mixed_PV_all$m, "), p = ", formatC(round(mixed_PV_all$QMp,3),format='f',digits=3),
        "; Residual heterogeneity (Qe ", formatC(round(mixed_PV_all$QE,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", mixed_PV_all$k-mixed_PV_all$p, "), p = ", formatC(round(mixed_PV_all$QEp,3),format='f',digits=3)),
        footnote_x_polio, footnote_y_polio, gp = gpar(fontsize=12, font = "sans")) }
    if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines>1 & mixed_PV_all$QEp<0.001) {

        "; Residual heterogeneity (Qe ", formatC(round(mixed_PV_all$QE,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", mixed_PV_all$k-mixed_PV_all$p, "), p < 0.001"),
        footnote_x_polio, footnote_y_polio, gp = gpar(fontsize=12, font = "sans")) }
    
    if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines==1 & meta_PV_all$QEp>=0.001) {
        grid.text(paste0("Heterogeneity (Q ", formatC(round(meta_PV_all$QE,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", meta_PV_all$k-meta_PV_all$p, "), p = ", formatC(round(meta_PV_all$QEp,3),format='f',digits=3)),
        0.1, footnote_y_polio, gp = gpar(fontsize=12, font = "sans")) }
    if (nrow(data_PV_all)>=min & n_PV_vaccines==1 & meta_PV_all$QEp<0.001) {
        grid.text(paste0("Heterogeneity (Q ", formatC(round(meta_PV_all$QE,2),format='f',digits=2), ", df ", meta_PV_all$k-meta_PV_all$p, "), p < 0.001"),
        0.1, footnote_y_polio, gp = gpar(fontsize=12, font = "sans")) }
    
} else { print("Insufficient studies (n<2)")}
```

### Funnel plot

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.height=3, fig.width=6}
# Draw funnel plot containing all results included in meta-analysis
if (overall_PV_sum>0) {
    overall_estimate = meta_PV_all$b
    funnel_input = data.frame(SE = sqrt(meta_PV_all$vi), LogRR = meta_PV_all$yi,
    Vaccine = substr(data_PV_all$Measure_of_SC,0,4), N = data_PV_all$Total, Study = data_PV_all$Reference)
    ggplot(funnel_input, aes(y=SE, x=LogRR)) + geom_point(aes(color = Vaccine), size=3.5, alpha=0.7) +
    geom_vline(xintercept=overall_estimate, color='grey', linetype='dashed') + theme_minimal() +
    ylab('SE (log RR)') + xlab('log RR') +  scale_y_reverse() + xlim(-2,2) +
    scale_color_manual(values = c("OPV1" = "#f1cd4f", "OPV2" = "#734109" , "OPV3" =  "#F1A44F")) +
    theme(legend.title=element_blank(), legend.position="right")
} else { print("Insufficient studies (n<2)")}
```

### Egger's test

Infants replicated across vaccines, therefore separate tests performed

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Perform Egger's test; this should be stratified by vaccine type to account for replication of infants across PV serotypes
print("OPV1:")
if (nrow(data_PV1)>=3) { print(regtest(meta_PV1, predictor="sei")) } else { print("Insufficient studies (n<3)")}
print("OPV2:")
if (nrow(data_PV2)>=3) { print(regtest(meta_PV2, predictor="sei")) } else { print("Insufficient studies (n<3)")}
print("OPV3:")
if (nrow(data_PV3)>=3) { print(regtest(meta_PV3, predictor="sei")) } else { print("Insufficient studies (n<3)")}
```
